title: Hotdog-Sandwich Classification Consensus Framework

prerequisites: Identify key stakeholder groups and recruit representatives
steps.outcome: Create a legitimate, authoritative body to define classification standards
risks: Difficulty achieving buy-in from all stakeholders
Potential for the council to become politicized

prerequisites: Conduct research on structural, cultural, and practical considerations
Engage stakeholders to understand diverse perspectives
steps.outcome: Establish a classification system that respects both structural and cultural factors
risks: Difficulty balancing competing priorities and finding consensus
Potential for the taxonomy to be overly complex or ambiguous

steps.action: Implement a Flexible Labeling and Packaging Standard
prerequisites: Collaborate with food producers, restaurants, and regulators
Ensure the standard is intuitive and user-friendly for consumers
steps.outcome: Provide clear, consistent guidance on hotdog and sandwich packaging and menus
risks: Resistance from stakeholders who prefer more rigid definitions
Difficulty enforcing the standard across a diverse food industry

prerequisites: Develop engaging, informative content on the classification framework
Leverage diverse media channels to reach a broad audience
steps.outcome: Increase public understanding and acceptance of the hybrid classification system
risks: Difficulty overcoming entrenched beliefs and biases
Potential for the campaign to be perceived as biased or partisan

prerequisites: Create a neutral, impartial panel to adjudicate classification disputes
Develop clear guidelines and procedures for submitting and reviewing cases
steps.outcome: Provide a formal process for resolving disagreements and maintaining the integrity of the classification system
risks: Difficulty ensuring the panel's decisions are accepted as legitimate
Potential for the process to become overly bureaucratic or time-consuming

resource_requirements: Funding for the Hotdog-Sandwich Classification Council
Research and development expertise in food taxonomy and classification
Collaboration with food industry, regulatory bodies, and academic institutions
Public relations and communications capabilities for the education campaign
